discussion.p: The function _Exit does not appear to be defined in this standard. Should it be added to the table of functions included-by-reference to the C standard?
discussion.note: 2009-05-09 Alisdair fixed some minor issues in the wording.
discussion.blockquote: We agree with the proposed resolution. Move to Tentatively Ready.

resolution.p: Add before the description of abort(void):

blockquote.p: The function _Exit(int status) has additional behavior in this International Standard:

ul.li: The program is terminated without executing destructors for objects of automatic, thread, or static storage duration and without calling the functions passed to atexit() ().
